reinforcement:
⚠️ SPACE OPTIMIZED — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: ALL furniture (Bed, Sofa, Table, everything) MUST be pushed flat against walls. Nothing floating.
- CRITICAL: The physical center of the room must be COMPLETELY EMPTY floor space. No furniture, no rugs in the middle.
- Sofa along a long wall, never floating.
- Table/Desk against a wall, preferably near window if available.
- Wide clear walking path from door to all zones.
- NO furniture within 3 feet of the door.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.

  - toilet (toilet_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
full_prompt:
TASK: Edit this 2D top-down floor plan to show the "Space Optimized" arrangement.

╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║  ⚠️  STRICT RULES                                            ║
╠══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╣
║  1. Exactly 14 movable items must appear.           ║
║  2. REQUIRED: [table, chair, chair, sofa, artwork, bed, nightstand, nightstand, plant, artwork, rug, rug, lamp, lamp]                             ║
║  3. DO NOT ADD or REMOVE any furniture.                      ║
║  4. DOOR (north (top) at ~46%): 2+ feet clear.               ║
║  5. DO NOT MOVE: [refrigerator, kitchen cabinet, kitchen sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]                             ║
║  6. OUTPUT = 2D TOP-DOWN VIEW (not 3D).                      ║
╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

⚠️ DO NOT DUPLICATE FURNITURE:
- This room has exactly: 1 table, 2 chairs, 1 sofa, 2 artworks, 1 bed, 2 nightstands, 1 plant, 2 rugs, 2 lamps.
- MOVE = ERASE from old spot + PLACE in new spot. Do NOT copy.
- If the same item appears in TWO places, the output is INVALID.
- COUNT each furniture type before finishing. Counts must match input.

⚠️ EXCLUSION ZONES — furniture MUST NOT overlap these fixed fixtures:
  - refrigerator (refrigerator_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - toilet (toilet_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.

STYLE: Space Optimized
This layout maximizes open floor space by strictly adhering to a perimeter arrangement. All furniture is placed against the walls, creating a large, uncluttered central corridor that enhances the sense of spaciousness and provides clear circulation from the entrance. Zones are defined along the walls to maintain functionality without compromising the open feel.

FURNITURE PLACEMENT — FOLLOW EXACTLY:
  • BED_1: Centered against the right (east) wall.
  • NIGHTSTAND_1: Against the right (east) wall, on the top side of bed_1.
  • NIGHTSTAND_2: Against the right (east) wall, on the bottom side of bed_1.
  • SOFA_1: Against the left (west) wall, positioned in the lower half of the room.
  • TABLE_1: Against the left (west) wall, between the kitchenette area and sofa_1.
  • CHAIR_1: At table_1, pushed in towards the table.
  • CHAIR_2: At table_1, pushed in towards the table, next to chair_1.
  • ARTWORK_1: Mounted on the left (west) wall, centered above sofa_1.
  • ARTWORK_2: Mounted on the right (east) wall, vertically aligned with nightstand_2.
  • PLANT_1: Placed in the corner where the right (east) wall meets the interior wall of the bathroom, next to nightstand_1.
  • RUG_1: On the floor against the bottom (south) wall, under the left window.
  • RUG_2: On the floor against the bottom (south) wall, under the right window.
  • LAMP_1: Placed on top of nightstand_1.
  • LAMP_2: Placed on top of nightstand_2.

ZONES:
  • work_zone: The work zone is integrated into the living area along the upper-left (north-west) wall, adjacent to the kitchenette.
  • sleep_zone: The sleep zone is located along the entire right (east) wall, creating a dedicated and separate resting area.
  • living_zone: The living zone is situated along the left (west) wall, with the sofa providing a comfortable seating area opposite the sleep zone.

⚠️ SPACE OPTIMIZED — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: ALL furniture (Bed, Sofa, Table, everything) MUST be pushed flat against walls. Nothing floating.
- CRITICAL: The physical center of the room must be COMPLETELY EMPTY floor space. No furniture, no rugs in the middle.
- Sofa along a long wall, never floating.
- Table/Desk against a wall, preferably near window if available.
- Wide clear walking path from door to all zones.
- NO furniture within 3 feet of the door.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.

DOOR CLEARANCE: The central area of the room is kept entirely empty, creating a wide and direct path from the door into the space. No furniture is placed within a 3-foot radius of the door, ensuring it is completely unobstructed.

STRUCTURAL (fixed): Door=north (top) at ~46%, Window=interior at ~50%, Others=[refrigerator, kitchen cabinet, kitchen sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]

OUTPUT: Same 2D style as input, all 14 items in their NEW positions, professional floor plan.
Do NOT place furniture on top of kitchen appliances, bathroom fixtures, or any structural element.
Edit the floor plan to show "Space Optimized".
